chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant David A Kozlowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.075(1r).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 149 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Sex offender treatment.
Register and comploy with sex offender registry.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Comply with any other conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.

Defendant David A Kozlowski in court, in custody, with attorney John Scott Schiro.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for twelve (12) person jury trial. This trial should take one day. Court will not empanel an alternate. Motion in limine addressed. Second motion in limine was withdrawn. Court addresses both motion in limine's. Court will exclude witnesses. No prior criminal convictions. Jurors to take notes. Court will give preliminary instructions. Jurors may ask questions of the witness in writing. Parties have no stipulations to put on the record at this time. Jury Instructions filed by the State.  Court is in recess. Court reconvenes. Jurors enter the courtroom. Court presents preliminary remarks to the jurors.  Clerk swears jurors voir dire. Clerk announces panel of twenty jurors. Court conducts voir dire. Juror Julie G. struck for cause.  Juror Timothy D. and Nancy R. struck for cause. State conducts voir dire. Defense conducts voir dire. Defense has a motion to put on the record outside the presence of the jurors. Court reconvenes. Counsels exercise four (4) strikes each. The following jurors are selected to try the issues:  Abby B., Christopher T., Max K., Richard L., Robert S., Katherine B., Mary K., Linda A., Steven K., Julie E., Justin R. and Sara H..  Clerk swears the jurors selected to try the issues. Court instructs the jurors. Jurors removed. Defense puts remarks on the record regarding motion in chambers on juror Tia T.. Court is in recess. Court reconvenes. Jurors enter the courtroom. State presents opening statements. Defense presents opening statements. Notebooks distributed to jurors.   Officer Tamara Taubel sworn and testified. Exh. S9, S10, S11, S12, S13, S14, S15, S16, S17, D1 marked. D1 published to the jurors. D2, D3, D4, D5, D6, D7 and D8 marked, offered and received. Jurors removed. Court is in recess. Case recalled. Jurors enter the courtroom. Officer Taubel returns to the witness stand acknowledging she is still under oath.  Jurors put questions in writing. Jurors removed. Court addresses questions with counsels. Jurors enter the courtroom. Witness asked questions by the jurors. Special Agent Eric Szatkowski sworn and testified. Defense requests to be heard outside the presence of the jurors. Court grants request. Jurors removed. Court is in short recess. Court reconvenes. Polygraphs addressed. Jurors enter the courtroom. Defense continues with cross. Jurors do not have any questions for the agent. State moves Exh. 1 and 9 -17 into evidence. Court receives 9-17 into evidence. Exh. 1 was already received. Defense moves to dismiss. Defense advises their client is not going to testify. Court denies the motion to dismiss. Court conducts colloquy with the defendant regarding his testifying. Defense rests. Court is in short recess. Court addresses jury instructions with counsels. Defense requests to make an offer of proof as to the polygraph. Court grants request. Jurors enter the courtroom. Defense rests on the record. State presents closing arguments. Defense presents closing arguments. State presents rebuttal arguments. Court instructs the jurors. Clerk swears bailiff in charge of the jurors. Jurors retire to the juryroom at 3:56 p.m. for deliberations. All exhibits to go to the jurors.  Court is in recess. Jurors reached a verdict at 5:22 p.m.. Court reconvenes. Jurors enter the courtroom. Juror's find the defendant GUILTY. Jurors are polled. Jurors are released. State requests Court enter judgment on the verdict. Court grants request. Defense moves for judgment notwithstanding the verdict. Court denies defense's motion. Court revokes bail. Court will set a date for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
